decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications:  21/SG/203 (Rev B), 21/SG/204 Received:  31 January 2025,  PP-13418185v1, 21/SG/201 (Rev A), 21/SG/202 (Rev A) Received:  19 November 2024.  

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows or openings shall be formed in the rear and side elevations of the development hereby permitted.

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy.
description: Erection of a single storey rear infill and rear extension and single storey rear infill extension (No. 31 Spring Grove) with the installation of four rear roof lights, replacement glazed sliding double rear doors (No. 29 Spring Grove) and three rear solar panels (No. 31 Spring Grove) to the amalgamated house.
